title: China Economy - South China Morning Post
description: China economy news, including budget, the stock market and analysis.

items.title: Youth unfulfilled: job opportunities in China’s senior-care sector go untapped
items.creator: Xinyi Wu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Youth unfulfilled: job opportunities in China’s senior-care sector go untapped
items.content:
As China rapidly ages, the senior-care sector is poised to become a significant source of job creation. Yet, enthusiasm among the nation’s young workforce remains lukewarm.
The care-services industry, including care for elderly residents, is projected to generate millions of jobs and become a driver of household consumption in the years to come, as national demographics shift towards an older population, according to He Dan, director of the China Population and Development Research Centre under...

items.title: Chinese airlines cancel flights on 12 Japan routes as tensions continue to rise
items.creator: Ralph Jennings,He Huifeng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese airlines cancel flights on 12 Japan routes as tensions continue to rise
items.content:
As a political dispute between Beijing and Tokyo continues to inflame relations, Chinese media reports indicate some domestic airlines have cancelled flights on 12 of their routes to Japan – including paths to popular tourism destinations Kyoto and Osaka – with analysts predicting cancellations to rise within the week.
As of Monday morning, flights on these routes had been put on hold, according to a report from financial news outlet Yicai that cited Chinese aviation data platform DAST. Domestic...

items.title: China strengthens global drone dominance with record orders at Dubai Airshow
items.creator: Alice Li
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China strengthens global drone dominance with record orders at Dubai Airshow
items.content:
A Chinese drone maker has secured 1,600 orders for industrial models at the recently concluded Dubai Airshow – marking the largest ever single-order deal for the country’s manufacturers at the biennial event, as its companies target emerging markets.
The deal, secured by Shenzhen-based United Aircraft, covered industrial drones used for low-altitude logistics, medical deliveries and agricultural applications in the United Arab Emirates and other markets, local outlet SZnews.com reported. The...

items.title: UBS’ China property optimist retreats from bullish calls, foresees deeper slump
items.creator: Bloomberg
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: UBS’ China property optimist retreats from bullish calls, foresees deeper slump

images.alt: Second-hand home prices are down more than a third from their peak levels in major metropolitan areas. Photo: EPA
images.title: Second-hand home prices are down more than a third from their peak levels in major metropolitan areas. Photo: EPA

items.content:
John Lam, UBS’ head of China property research and a long-time contrarian, is retreating from his earlier bullish calls and joining his Wall Street peers in predicting that the country’s four-year real estate downturn is far from over.
Lam said he expected home prices to fall for at least another two years before a recovery in mainland China’s beleaguered residential property market could take hold. One reason was that potential buyers were increasingly opting to rent properties while prices...

items.title: Rising down jacket sales offer cushion against deflation in mainland China
items.creator: Daniel Ren
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Rising down jacket sales offer cushion against deflation in mainland China

images.alt: The mainland’s market for down jackets, which was valued at about 200 billion yuan in 2023, was likely to grow at an annualised 11 per cent from 2024 to 2028, according to Huayuan Securities. Photo: AFP
images.title: The mainland’s market for down jackets, which was valued at about 200 billion yuan in 2023, was likely to grow at an annualised 11 per cent from 2024 to 2028, according to Huayuan Securities. Photo: AFP

items.content:
China’s down jacket and coat makers are the unlikely beneficiaries of the winter season, as more young consumers splash out on coveted brands despite significant price increases.
Buoyed by strong buying interest in mid to high-end winter wear, retailers like Bosideng expect the sales boom to continue over the next three months as the weather gets colder.
“Garment makers that offer clothes specific for winter have received a windfall from the cold temperatures this year,” Shanghai-based...

items.title: ‘A mistaken view’: US economist Nicholas Lardy on the ‘peak China’ hypothesis
items.creator: Frank Tang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: ‘A mistaken view’: US economist Nicholas Lardy on the ‘peak China’ hypothesis
items.content:
Nicholas Lardy is a non-resident senior fellow at the Peterson Institute for International Economics and a member of the Council on Foreign Relations, both Washington-based think tanks. He has studied the Chinese economy extensively, publishing several books on its growth and development since the late 1970s. His most recent, 2019’s The State Strikes Back, posits a rollback of Beijing’s economic reforms via renewed government intervention into the market.
This interview first appeared in SCMP...

items.title: Snowcapped prosperity: China’s winter sports market glides upwards
items.creator: He Huifeng
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Snowcapped prosperity: China’s winter sports market glides upwards
items.content:
Each winter for the past three years, Claire Zhou, a teenager from the southern Chinese city of Guangzhou, has counted down the days until she can fly to northern China and pull on a new ski suit and boots.
The better she skis, the more frequently she upgrades her gear, reshaping her family’s holiday budget and pulling them deeper into China’s fast-growing winter sports consumption chain.
The country’s winter sports boom, sparked by the 2022 Beijing Winter Olympics and fuelled by supportive...

items.title: Ireland business chamber welcomes Chinese investment despite US, EU pressures
items.creator: Xiaofei Xu
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Ireland business chamber welcomes Chinese investment despite US, EU pressures
items.content:
Chinese investment is still being actively welcomed in Ireland, the head of a major business organisation said, even as the wider European Union adopts a more cautious attitude and Dublin walks a tightrope to maintain ties with both the US and China amid a wide-ranging rivalry between the world’s two largest economies.
“We’re firmly open for business within the EU rules, that is an unambiguous position,” Mary Rose Burke, CEO of the Dublin Chamber of Commerce, told the Post in an interview last...

items.title: ‘Limited alternatives’: why Japan will struggle to replace China’s tourists
items.creator: Ralph Jennings
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: ‘Limited alternatives’: why Japan will struggle to replace China’s tourists
items.content:
Japan will find it hard to replace the revenue lost if Chinese tourists keep avoiding the country amid a diplomatic row over Taiwan, a subsidiary of the data provider Fitch Solutions warned on Friday.
A sustained drop-off in visitor numbers from China would “significantly impact” Japan’s retail and tourism industries, as Chinese tourists were not only Japan’s largest source of overseas visitors but were also higher-than-average spenders, subsidiary BMI said in a research note.
In the short term,...

items.title: Chinese vice-premier urges manufacturing upgrades, trade diversification
items.creator: Sylvia Ma
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese vice-premier urges manufacturing upgrades, trade diversification
items.content:
Vice-Premier He Lifeng has emphasised the need to diversify China’s export markets and sustain trade growth, while urging local-level officials to empower enterprises and enhance policy support to strengthen manufacturing.
His remarks came during a three-day inspection tour that concluded on Thursday in the central provinces of Hubei and Hunan, where he learned about the operations of local trade logistics firms, export-oriented manufacturers and consumer-sector companies, according to...

items.title: Chinese commerce minister calls for deeper US-China cooperation on trade
items.creator: Carol Yang
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese commerce minister calls for deeper US-China cooperation on trade
items.content:
Chinese Commerce Minister Wang Wentao called for China and the United States to make joint efforts to manage uncertainties and expand cooperation on trade during a meeting with the US ambassador to China, David Perdue, in Beijing on Thursday.
The two countries should maintain a “correct understanding” of the fact that China and the US must find ways to coexist and that win-win outcomes could be achieved, Wang said, according to a statement released by the commerce ministry after the...

items.title: ‘Unpredictable risks’: China to see record graduates next year amid jobs crunch
items.creator: Mandy Zuo
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: ‘Unpredictable risks’: China to see record graduates next year amid jobs crunch
items.content:
China is preparing for an unprecedented wave of new university graduates next summer – a record 12.7 million outgoing students – intensifying pressure on an already strained job market and a slowing economy.
The 2026 cohort will be about 4 per cent larger than the 12.22 million graduates in 2025 – an additional 480,000 young people competing for jobs, according to the Ministry of Education. It announced the figures on Thursday, as it launched new campaigns to ensure sufficient opportunities.
The...

items.title: China’s EV parts could be in Tesla’s crosshairs – is a total ‘de-risk’ feasible?

items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s EV parts could be in Tesla’s crosshairs – is a total ‘de-risk’ feasible?
items.content:
Tesla’s reported plan to stop using Chinese-made components in US-built cars aligns with a “significant strategy” in national industrial policy, with some American giants seeking to “completely de-risk” supply chains amid an increasingly tense geopolitical climate, an automotive executive said.
Curt Hopkins, CEO of automotive investment platform MCQ Markets in Miami, said Tesla appeared to be “developing a completely dual strategy, where in the US they’re going to de-China, diversify and make...

items.title: China has lent more to US than any other country since 2000, report finds
items.creator: Ralph Jennings
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China has lent more to US than any other country since 2000, report finds
items.content:
China’s lending since the turn of the century has been “vastly” larger than previously understood, with loans and grants increasingly going to developed countries including the United States – the largest recipient – according to a new report by an American university research team.
Of the US$2.2 trillion disbursed by China’s “official sector” between 2000 and 2023, nearly US$202 billion went to projects in the US, the AidData research lab at Virginia-based university William & Mary found.
“Our...

items.title: As China’s tech rises, companies must rethink their R&D strategy
items.creator: Ni Tao
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: As China’s tech rises, companies must rethink their R&D strategy
items.content:
For years, many foreign companies treated China as a vast consumer base or a low-cost manufacturing hub. Now that paradigm is shifting dramatically. China is not just where multinationals scale production or sell at volume; it is increasingly where they make strategic decisions, engage in serious research and development and innovate in ways that will have a global impact.
For example, take Toyota’s R&D centre in Changshu, Jiangsu province. Led by local engineers, it has helped develop electric...

items.title: China buys Russian LNG at record-high levels, steep discounts as West retreats
items.creator: Mia Nurmamat,Sylvia Ma
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China buys Russian LNG at record-high levels, steep discounts as West retreats
items.content:
China’s intake of Russian liquefied natural gas (LNG) surged to an all-time high in October as Western sanctions forced a retreat by other buyers and redirected cargoes, while analysts said that key drivers included discounted prices and Beijing’s shift to non-US suppliers.
Chinese customs data released on Thursday showed that imports from Russia jumped by 76.7 per cent, year on year, to 1.3 million tonnes – the first time monthly volumes from across the northern border topped 1 million tonnes,...

items.title: Chinese rare earth magnet exports to US hit 9-month high as trade war resolves
items.creator: Alice Li
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: Chinese rare earth magnet exports to US hit 9-month high as trade war resolves
items.content:
China’s shipments of rare earth permanent magnets to the US surged to a nine-month high in October as the two countries engaged in a roller-coaster round of manoeuvring over export controls that led to an easing of trade tensions late last month.
During the same period, exports to the European Union fell from the level recorded in September.
China is the world’s largest supplier of permanent magnets – essential components in hi-tech products such as electric vehicles and defence systems – and...

items.title: China’s exports at risk? US, EU may push tough rules of origin: economist
items.creator: Alice Li,Sylvia Ma
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s exports at risk? US, EU may push tough rules of origin: economist
items.content:
China should prepare for stricter US and EU regulations on global rules of origin – as signalled in the recent trade deal between the Western economic powers – with the changes potentially weighing on its export sector by redefining global trade patterns, according to a Chinese economist.
“Trump’s current measures are temporary – tariffs can be imposed today and rolled back or even eliminated tomorrow. The real question for us is what the future global trade framework looks like,” said Zhang...

items.title: ‘Impossible to achieve’: why China can’t grow enough soybeans to feed itself
items.creator: Mandy Zuo
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: ‘Impossible to achieve’: why China can’t grow enough soybeans to feed itself
items.content:
Soybeans are more than just a crop – they have become a litmus test of Beijing’s evolving food security strategy and sit at the heart of the US-China trade war.
As a crucial source of animal feed and cooking oil, soybeans have remained a flashpoint throughout the ebbs and flows of the two nations’ trade disputes, from the tariff war during US President Donald Trump’s first term to the current one.
Less well known is China’s transformation from soybean exporter to the world’s leading importer....

items.title: China’s US Treasury holdings edge up as long-term sell-off continues
items.creator: Sylvia Ma,Frank Chen
items.summary: 无法生成摘要（API请求失败）。
items.translated_title: China’s US Treasury holdings edge up as long-term sell-off continues
items.content:
China slightly increased its US Treasury holdings in August and September – though the uptick did little to offset an overall downward trend – as persistent worries over US debt sustainability and the Federal Reserve’s independence deepened doubts about the safety of assets backed by the US dollar.
The country’s stockpile rose to US$701 billion in August, up from July’s multi-year low of US$696.9 billion, but it again trimmed the total to US$700.5 billion in September, according to data from the...
